title: Macbook Pro A1398 - 820-3332A. No Fan Spin.
message:
Macbook Pro A1398 - 820-3332A. Fan spins continuously on battery but no chime and no display. No fan spin without battery, Yellow light on Magsafe Adapter. Checked all voltage rails and results as below.

PPBUS_G3H = 12.6v
PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS = 12.6v
PPVIN_S5_HS_GPU_ISNS = 12.6v
PPVIN_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS = 12.6v
PP18V5_DCIN_CONN = 16.3v
PP3V42_G3H = 3.4v
PP5V_S5 = 5.1 v
PP3V3_S4 = Missing.

What next?

title: Macbook Pro A1398 - 820-3332A. No Fan Spin.
message:
This board will not start without 85W charger, if battery not present.
Board turns on with both charger and battery connected?
Do you get USB activity?

Start resoldering U8900 with leaded solder.

title: Macbook Pro A1398 - 820-3332A. No Fan Spin.
message: Yes. board turns on with both charger and battery connected and after connecting to 85w charger, turns on without battery. USB activity - just the red light on. no blinking. Fan spins but no display.

title: Macbook Pro A1398 - 820-3332A. No Fan Spin.
message: And i even get 3.3v on  PP3V3_S4.

title: Macbook Pro A1398 - 820-3332A. No Fan Spin.
message: Do you get voltages on CPU and GPU coils?

title: Macbook Pro A1398 - 820-3332A. No Fan Spin.
Macbook Pro A1398 - 820-3332A. No Fan Spin.
message:
You should get voltage on L8930/60.
L7550/60 only get voltage under heavy graphics load, when Intel graphics is used.

Check GPU Rail Sequencing, page 88.

title: Macbook Pro A1398 - 820-3332A. No Fan Spin.
message:
Checked rails and result... I hope i am doing it right. All rails showing 3.3v doesn't seem right.... 
P3V3GPU_EN - R9121 Pin 1 - 3,3v
P1V8GPU_EN - R9122 Pin 1 - 3.3v
GPUVCORE_EN - R9123 Pin 1 - 3.3v
P1V35GPUFB_EN - R9124 Pin 1 - 3.3v
P1V05_S0GPU_EN - R9125 Pin 1 - 3.3v

title: Macbook Pro A1398 - 820-3332A. No Fan Spin.
message:
You measured enable signals.
Check if each power supply which receive the enable, generates output voltage...

title: Macbook Pro A1398 - 820-3332A. No Fan Spin.
message: please... can u explain once how i do it. Just an example with 1 rail.

title: Macbook Pro A1398 - 820-3332A. No Fan Spin.
message:
P3V3GPU_EN controls 3V3_GPU and so on.
Follow each enable signal and see if corresponding power supply (just a MOSFET in some case), generates the output voltage.
P3V3GPU_EN  --> Q7872 --> Q7870 --> 3V3_GPU...

title: Macbook Pro A1398 - 820-3332A. No Fan Spin.
message: Just a quick observation. I was checking GPU voltages and found PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG - 900mv on Pin 1 of C8961/63. I was wondering if this is the cause of the problem. Should I change U8900 and check? Just a thought before I post the voltages you asked for later today.

title: Macbook Pro A1398 - 820-3332A. No Fan Spin.
message: 0.9V looks good for GPU VCORE.

title: Macbook Pro A1398 - 820-3332A. No Fan Spin.
message:
Findings as requested. Hope i am on the right track...


P3V3GPU_EN - PP3V3_S0GPU – Q7870 Pin 2 – 3.3v
P3V3GPU_EN_L – Q7872 Pin 3 – 300mv
GPUVCORE_PGOOD – U8900 Pin 1 – 3.1v
GPUFB_PGOOD - U8350 Pin 14 – 1.7v
P1V05_S0GPU_PGOOD – U8310 Pin 9 – 1.8v

title: Macbook Pro A1398 - 820-3332A. No Fan Spin.
message:
Seems that you didn't understand me.
I said
"P3V3GPU_EN  --> Q7872 --> Q7870 --> 3V3_GPU"
in other words, if 3V3GPU_EN is present, then 3V3_GPU must be present too.
I was expecting that you apply the same rule for the other GPU rails...

title: Macbook Pro A1398 - 820-3332A. No Fan Spin.
message: Sorry.. I simply can’t get the hang of this one. Any links where I can read up on this. I feel I should give up on this board.

title: Macbook Pro A1398 - 820-3332A. No Fan Spin.
message:
Search in pdf for each signal name and found corresponding power supplies.

Check voltage at L8360, L8310, L8930/60 and Q7870 output.

title: Macbook Pro A1398 - 820-3332A. No Fan Spin.
message:
Checked voltage at
L8360 – 1.5v
L8310 – 1.06v
L8930 – 900 mv
L8960 – 905 mv
Q7870 output. – 3.3v

title: Macbook Pro A1398 - 820-3332A. No Fan Spin.
message:
So GPU voltages are good.
Then what was this???
"L8960 - L8930 - No voltage"
When do we expect to have correct information reported?

title: Macbook Pro A1398 - 820-3332A. No Fan Spin.
message: I am sorry but this is what it is. Just 900mv on both the coils.

title: Macbook Pro A1398 - 820-3332A. No Fan Spin.
message:
"Just 900mv on both the coils".
And is the exact voltage must be there.

Post exact voltage at L7510/20/30 in the first moment and after 10-15 seconds.
One coil is sufficient to measure.

title: Macbook Pro A1398 - 820-3332A. No Fan Spin.
message: 1.118v on L7510 right from the moment it starts and steady after 20 seconds...

title: Macbook Pro A1398 - 820-3332A. No Fan Spin.
message:
So board doesn't really boot.
VCORE should drop to 0.78V aprox, when does.

Try known good RAM module, each slot separately.

title: Macbook Pro A1398 - 820-3332A. No Fan Spin.
message: Am I missing something here.... aren't the ram modules soldered on board. how do I change the ram modules.

title: Macbook Pro A1398 - 820-3332A. No Fan Spin.
message:
Right, I was thinking about 3330 board, sorry.

You can try to disable GPU, just in case.
The necessary information is already posted on the forum.
